alert.note: Alert for Macon (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 9:06PM EDT until May 28 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall and continued runoff including upstream dam releases. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Georgia and western North Carolina, including the following counties, in northeast Georgia, Rabun. In western North Carolina, Macon. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 854 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate up to 5 inches of rain has fallen over the area today. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Continued rises along area streams may be enhanced by upstream dam releases and another round of incoming showers and thunderstorms from the southwest. - The incoming storms could produce 1-2 inches of new rainfall, which may require an upgrade to a flash flood warning later tonight or during the early overnight hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Franklin, Clayton, Highlands, Mountain City, Tiger, Dillard, Sky Valley, Tallulah Falls, Black Rock Mountain State Park, Lake Burton, Lakemont, Lake Rabun, Nantahala Lake, Tallulah Gorge State Park, Otto, Scaly Mountain, Rainbow Springs, Cullasaja, Burningtown and Wayah Bald. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
